alert.note: Alert for Benton; Jasper; Newton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 23 at 2:43PM EDT until July 23 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT/715 PM EDT/ THIS EVENING FOR IROQUOIS, BENTON, SOUTHERN JASPER AND SOUTHERN NEWTON COUNTIES... At 143 PM CDT /243 PM EDT/, doppler radar indicated another band of showers and thunderstorms moving into the warned area. Radar estimates and rain gauge measurements indicate between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Rainfall rates up to 1 inch in 1 hour are possible. HAZARD...Flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Rapid-onset flooding of small creeks and streams, roadways, underpasses, and other poor drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rensselaer, Watseka, Fowler, Gilman, Kentland, Clifton, Milford, Remington, Morocco, Onarga, Oxford, Sheldon, Chebanse, Goodland, Brook, Ashkum, Martinton, Earl Park, Stockland and Crescent City. If rainfall rates increase, worsening of flash flood impacts may occur. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
